IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: OUR MISSION IS TO SECURE AND STEWARD PHILANTHROPIC SUPPORT TO ENHANCE HILLSBOROUGH COMMUNITY COLLEGE AND THE SUCCESS OF ITS STUDENTS. AT THE HCC FOUNDATION, WE SUPPORT HCC IN ITS MISSION TO DELIVER AFFORDABLE EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES THAT HELP STUDENTS BECOME SUCCESSFUL, PRODUCTIVE CITIZENS
IRS990.MissionDesc: SECURE AND STEWARD PHILANTHROPIC SUPPORT TO ENHANCE HCC AND THE SUCCESS OF ITS STUDENTS. THROUGH ANNUAL SCHOLARSHIPS, ENDOWMENTS, AND PROGRAM AND FACULTY SUPPORT, WE HAVE AWARDED MORE THAN $14 MILLION SINCE OUR INCEPTION AND CHANGED THOUSANDS OF LIVES FOR THE BETTER.
IRS990.Desc: SCHOLARSHIPS: ASSISTED OVER 1,000 STUDENTS DURING THE FISCAL YEAR, THE VAST MAJORITY OF WHOM HAVE FINANCIAL NEED.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: HAWKS LANDING: 420-BED STUDENT HOUSING FACILITY TO ENHANCE THE STUDENT EXPERIENCE AT HCC AND ENHANCE LEARNING.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: HCC PROGRAM SUPPORT: PROVIDED SUPPORT OF STUDENTS AND FACULTY THROUGH LAUNCHING NEW PROGRAMS OF STUDY, CREATING FOOD PANTRIES FOR NEEDY STUDENTS, MAKING GRANTS TO FACULTY AND STAFF FOR CURRICULAR ENHANCEMENT AND NEW INITIATIVES, AND SUPPORTING COLLEGE PRIORITIES AND EXISTING PROGRAMS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: REPRESENTS HILLSBOROUGH COMMUNITY COLLEGE BEFORE THE STATE OF FLORIDA'S EXECUTIVE AND LEGISLATIVE BRANCHES OF GOVERNMENT IN ORDER TO ADVANCE THE COLLEGE'S POLICY AND APPROPRIATIONS PRIORITIES.
TO SUPPORT SCHOLARSHIPS AND COLLEGE PRIORITIES

THE FOUNDATION IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES, EXCEPT ON "UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME", UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE U.S. INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND APPLICABLE STATE STATUTE. THERE WAS NO UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2023, THEREFORE, NO TAX WAS DUE. THE FOUNDATION FOLLOWS THE INCOME TAX STANDARD FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. THE FOUNDATION HAS EVALUATED THEIR TAX PROVISIONS AND DETERMINED THEY HAVE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AS OF JUNE 30, 2023.

THE FOUNDATION RECEIVED A TOTAL OF $681,930 IN DONATED SERVICES AND FACILITIES WHICH REDUCED THE REPORTED SALARIES AND BENEFITS; TRAVEL, CONFERENCES, AND TRAINING; SOFTWARE COSTS; AND VARIOUS OFFICE RELATED EXPENSES.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: PROVIDE DIRECT SUPPORT FOR HILLSBOROUGH COMMUNITY COLLEGE PROGRAMS AND PRIORITIES.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.ValuationMethodUsedDesc: INVOICES RECEIVED FROM HILLSBOROUGH COMMUNITY COLLEGE

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MOST AWARDS ARE MADE VIA OUR ONLINE APPLICATION PROCESS IN WHICH STUDENTS COMPLETE AN HCC FOUNDATION SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION TO BE CONSIDERED FOR A SCHOLARSHIP. APPLICATIONS ARE SCORED BY VOLUNTEERS AND THEN REVIEWED BY A COMMITTEE TO ENSURE STUDENTS SELECTED MEET THE DONOR/GRANTOR CRITERIA. OTHER STUDENTS MAY BE SELECTED BY: HILLSBOROUGH COMMUNITY COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER DONOR/GRANTOR CRITERIA OR; CERTAIN HCC ACADEMIA DEPARTMENTS MAY RECOMMEND OR SELECT STUDENTS FOR AWARDS BY APPLYING DONOR/GRANTOR CRITERIA.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: MR. BAILEY IS A PRINCIPLE WITH AN ADVISORY GROUP THAT PROVIDES THE MAJORITY OF THE INVESTMENT ADVISORY SERVICES FOR THE FOUNDATION. AS OF JUNE 30, 2023, FEES PAID DURING THE YEAR ENDED TOTALED $53,963. THE DIRECTOR DOES NOT PARTICIPATE IN THE PROCESS OR VOTE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL CONSIST OF THE CHAIR OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, THE VICE CHAIR, THE TREASURER, THE PRESIDENT'S DESIGNEE, THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES' DESIGNEE, THE CHAIR OF EACH OF THE STANDING COMMITTEES AND THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, EX-OFFICIO. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS MAY CHOOSE UP TO TWO ADDITIONAL MEMBERS TO SERVE ON THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL EXERCISE THE POWERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS BETWEEN MEETINGS, AT TIMES OF EMERGENCY OR WHEN IT IS IMPRACTICAL TO CONVENE THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. IT SHALL REPORT ITS ACTIONS AT THE NEXT MEETING OF THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR APPROVAL OR OTHER CONSIDERATION. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL NOT HAVE THE AUTHORITY TO ELECT OR REMOVE OFFICERS, DISSOLVE THE CORPORATION, AMEND OR REPEAL THE BYLAWS, FILL VACANCIES ON THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OR ANY COMMITTEE THEREOF, OR CHANGE THE NUMBER OF MEMBERS ON THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A DRAFT OF THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL PRIOR TO ITS FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S OPERATING GUIDELINES CONTAIN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. A PARTY WHO GAINS KNOWLEDGE OF AN ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST TRANSACTION INVOLVING THE FOUNDATION OR THE COLLEGE SHALL PROMPTLY DISCLOSE IT TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF THE FOUNDATION. EACH INDIVIDUAL COVERED BY THIS GUIDELINE SHALL PROVIDE THE ANNUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE FORM TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS EACH YEAR FOR A CERTIFICATION THAT THE INDIVIDUAL IS NOT ENGAGED IN ANY CONFLICT OF INTEREST TRANSACTIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS FORM 990 AND AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE ON THEIR WEBSITE. THE ORGANIZATION MAINTAINS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND OPERATING GUIDELINES INCLUDING CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, WHISTLE-BLOWER POLICY AND RECORDS RETENTION POLICY AT 4115 N. LOIS AVENUE, TAMPA, FL 33614. THE ORGANIZATION WILL MAKE THESE DOCUMENTS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990 PART XII, LINE 2C, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND REPORTING
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PROCESS FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEARS.
